text: [ANN] FlatGeobuf 0.1 has been released :tada: . <https://github.com/evetion/FlatGeobuf.jl>. It's a parser of the flatgeobuf format (<https://bjornharrtell.github.io/flatgeobuf/>), a replacement of shapefiles and other formats based on flatbuffers. It's a work in progress, but the basics are there.

attachments.title: FlatGeobuf
attachments.text: A performant binary encoding for geographic data based on flatbuffers

elements.text: . It's a parser of the flatgeobuf format (
), a replacement of shapefiles and other formats based on flatbuffers. It's a work in progress, but the basics are there.

text: Nice work! It's worth noting that GDAL has flatgeobuf support from version 3.1, so it already works in recent versions of QGIS for instance. The GDAL build in Julia is still on 3.0.4 for now, that just needs a volunteer :)
